gameDescription: Two advanced airships, controlled by humane humans vested with the mission of wildlife conservation, embark on a strategic quest. Their objective is to transport rescued pangolins from areas of severe poaching to a new sanctuary in Vietnam, contributing to Greater Good Charities Project Peril. This eco-mission is laced with decision making that directly impacts the survival of these endangered species and the overall natural environment.

setting.missionEnd: A new pangolin enclosure in Vietnam

blueTeam.name: Sky Guardians
blueTeam.description: Specializing in swift cargo retrieval and direct engagement.

redTeam.name: Eco Voyagers
redTeam.description: Proficient in diplomatic yet firm negotiation with illegal traders.

turns.scenario: Open ground markets are spotted with ample pangolin trade. The airships have to decide how to intervene.

options.A: Directly engage in confiscating the pangolins.
options.B: Leverage connections with local law enforcement to intervene.

AA.narrative: Both teams engage directly in rescuing the pangolins. While they are successful, the attention they attract might lead to increased elusive trade behaviors.

AB.narrative: One team confiscates the pangolins directly while the other inspires law enforcement to act. The confiscated pangolins are quickly secured, but the subsequent interference might heighten smuggling activities.

BA.narrative: While one team reaches out to law enforcement, the other swoops down to rescue. The combined efforts succeed in closing down a major trade hub, but caution must be employed in future rescues.

BB.narrative: Both teams coordinate with law enforcement agencies. Though a slower process, the subsequent crackdown gains significant media coverage, creating awareness and potentially discouraging future illegal trade.

turns.scenario: During transport, the pangolins show signs of distress and one ship falls behind schedule.

options.A: Speed up to make up for lost time, potentially causing more distress to the pangolins.
options.B: Maintain the speed to ensure the pangolins comfort, even if it means a delayed arrival.

AA.narrative: Both airships decide to speed up. While they reach their destination on time, the pangolins take longer to adapt to their new enclosure due to the stressful journey.

AB.narrative: One airship speeds up while the other maintains its pace. The stressed pangolins from the faster ship require more care which the slower ship can offer upon arrival.

BA.narrative: With one airship prioritizing pangolin comfort and one speeding up, the balanced approach minimizes stress on the pangolins and ensures on-time delivery of care resources.

BB.narrative: Both airships choose to prioritize the pangolins' comfort over arrival time. This decision, while delaying their mission, ensures the pangolins arrive in a more stable state, ready to adapt to their new sanctuary.

turns.scenario: Upon arrival in Vietnam, the airships have to decide how to introduce the pangolins to their new enclosure.

options.A: Release all pangolins at once to encourage group cohesion.
options.B: Release pangolins individually to allow each to adapt at its own pace.

AA.narrative: Both airships release the pangolins together. Panic ensues, but it quickly subsides and a tangible sense of community amongst the pangolins is observed.

AB.narrative: One airship releases the pangolins collectively, while the other does so individually. The collective release grounds the individual ones, resulting in a protective environment for the pangolins.

BA.narrative: One airship chooses a collective release, while the other goes for individual releases. The individually released pangolins provide a calming influence, easing the transition for the others.

BB.narrative: Both airships release the pangolins individually. While time-consuming, this allows each pangolin the space to adjust at their own pace, enabling a more efficient adaptation to their new environment.
